entry.title: Aurora philanthropists discuss strategic giving for human rights and equality

media:group.media:title: Aurora philanthropists discuss strategic giving for human rights and equality
media:group.media:description:
Partner content.
How can philanthropy drive impactful change in human rights interventions? This question was explored at the Human Rights and Humanitarian Forum held in Los Angeles in May 2024. Organized by the Aurora Humanitarian Initiative, in collaboration with UCLAโs The Promise Institute for Human Rights, the forum brought together prominent leaders in global philanthropy. Panelists included Amy Rao, Executive Vice President of the Schmidt Family Foundation; Negar Tayyar, Co-Founder and Executive Director of the Global Whole Being Fund; and Karen Ansara, Board Chair of NEID Global. Moderated by Sasha Chanoff, Founder and CEO of RefugePoint, the discussion explored the pressing challenges and opportunities facing philanthropy in a world of increasing crises.

entry.title: Pashinyan warns of Azerbaijanโs territorial demands on Armenia

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan warns of Azerbaijanโs territorial demands on Armenia
media:group.media:description:
๐ While speaking of Yerevanโs constructive engagement in normalization talks with Baku, Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan pushed back against rhetoric from Azerbaijan that appears to make claims on Armenian territory. ๐ Armenia, Greece, and Cyprus stepped up their defense collaboration following a series of consultations held in Athens yesterday. The visit resulted in a defense cooperation plan for 2025, covering a wide range of military projects. ๐ The European Parliament adopted a resolution yesterday calling for the immediate release of all political prisoners in Azerbaijan ๐ Arpine Sargsyan's rise to Armenia's Interior Ministry: https://youtu.be/oTPEDhgiPTQ?si=w9TESrQNNCr_1DYq ๐ Armenia's evolving military capabilities: https://youtu.be/X3iutd2ScSM?si=tmHJAaypyDC3FU3z

entry.title: Armenia in the age of genocide

media:group.media:title: Armenia in the age of genocide
media:group.media:description:
In this interview, genocide scholar Henry C. Theriault provides analysis on the ongoing threats of genocide faced by the Armenian people amid the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict. Theriault delves into the legal and political obstacles Armenia confronts in pursuing reparations for the ethnic cleansing of Artsakh, as well as strategies for fostering reconciliation and countering denial.

media:group.media:title: ิฟีกึีดีซึ ีฃีฎีฅึีซ ีฉีกีถีฏีกึีธึีดีจี ีกีถีพีกีพีฅึ. ีซีถีน ีฅีถ ีกีฝีธึีด ึีกีฒีกึีกึีซีถีฅึีจ
media:group.media:description:
2025-ีซึ ิตึึีกีถีธึีด ีกีพีฟีธีฏีกีตีกีถีกีฟีฅีฒีซีถีฅึีซ ีพีณีกึีจ 12,000 ีคึีกีดีซึ ีคีกึีฑีกีพ 24,000 ีคึีกีด ิฒ ีฃีธีฟีธึ ีฐีกีดีกึ ึ 165,000 ีคึีกีดี ิฑ ีฃีธีฟีธึี ึีกีฒีกึีซ ีฏีฅีถีฟึีธีถีซ ีฐีกีดีกึึ ีีกีญึ ึีฅีซีถ ีคีกีฟีกึีกีถีจ ีฃีถีซ ีขีกึีฑึีกึีดีกีถ ึีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีฟีกึีกีถีซ ีธึีธีทีธึีดีถ ีกีถีพีกีพีฅึ ีง ีณีกีถีกีนีพีฅีฌึ ีีกีตึีจ ีถีฅึีฏีกีตีกึึีฅีฌ ีง ิตึึีกีถีซ ีกีพีกีฃีกีถีธึ ยซีีกีตึ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถยป ีทีกึีชีดีกีถ ีฒีฅีฏีกีพีกึ ิฑีถีคึีกีถีซีฏ ินึีกีถีตีกีถีจึ ีีกึีนีกีฏีกีถ ีคีกีฟีกึีกีถีซ ีฏีกีตีกึึีกีฎ ีธึีธีทีธึีดีจ ีธึีชีซ ีดีฅีป ีคีฅีผ ีนีซ ีดีฟีฅีฌึ ีีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีฟีกึีกีถีซ ีดีกีดีธึีฌีซ ึีกึีฟีธึีฒีกึ ีีกีตีฏ ิฟีธีฝีฟีกีถีตีกีถีจ ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีฅีฌ ีง, ีธึ ึีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีกึีกีถีจ ีฏีขีธีฒีธึีกึีฏีซ ีคีกีฟีกึีกีถีซ ีธึีธีทีธึีดีจ, ีฅีฉีฅ ีกีถีฃีกีด ีธึีธีทีธึีดีถ ีกีถีพีกีพีฅึ ีณีกีถีกีนีพีซ, ีฃีธึีดีกึีซ ีพีฅึีกีคีกึีฑ ีนีซ ีฌีซีถีซึ

entry.title: Government eliminates major conscription law loophole

media:group.media:title: Government eliminates major conscription law loophole
media:group.media:description:
๐ In a significant move to reduce government spending, Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan's initiative to cut official vehicles has so far resulted in at least a 38% reduction in the state vehicle fleet. ๐ Yerevan Mayor Tigran Avinyan announced that his father has filed a lawsuit against CivilNet over a corruption investigation. ๐ Armenia's government today approved amendments to close a loophole in military service regulations that allowed conscripts to indefinitely postpone their service through repeated one-year medical deferrals.

media:group.media:title: Armenia's evolving military capabilities
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the Civilnet Podcast, APRI fellow and military analyst Leonid Nersisyan provides an in-depth assessment of the ongoing reforms and developments within Armenia's armed forces. Nersisyan delves into the country's recent defense procurement and training initiatives with France and India, as well as the steps Armenia is taking to counter Azerbaijan's military capabilities. The discussion offers insights into the evolving security landscape in the South Caucasus and the strategic considerations shaping Armenia's military modernization efforts.

entry.title: Arpine Sargsyan's rise to Armenia's Interior Ministry

media:group.media:title: Arpine Sargsyan's rise to Armenia's Interior Ministry
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian offers a comprehensive analysis of the landmark appointment of Arpine Sargsyan as Armenia's new Interior Minister. Sargsyan's rise to the position represents a significant milestone for female leadership in the country, shattering long standing glass ceilings in the traditionally male-dominated realm of law enforcement and national security. Hacopian delves into the political implications of Sargsyan's appointment, exploring the challenges and opportunities it presents for Armenia's ongoing democratic development and efforts to promote greater gender equality in positions of authority.

media:group.media:title: ิปีถีนีธีึ ีง ิฟิฒ-ีถ ีซีปีฅึึีฅีฌ ีฃีถีกีณีซ ีฉีซึีกีญีจ, ึ ีซีถีนีธีึ ีนีฅีถ ีงีชีกีถีกีถีธึีด ีพีกึีฏีฅึีจ
media:group.media:description:
ิฟีฅีถีฟึีธีถีกีฏีกีถ ีขีกีถีฏีซ ึีธีญีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ ิฑึีดีฅีถ ีีธึึีขีฅีฏีตีกีถีจ ยซีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉ ีขีซีฆีถีฅีฝยป-ีซีถ ีฟีพีกีฎ ีฐีกึึีกีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด ีขีกึีกีฟึีฅีฌ ีง ีฃีถีกีณีซ ีฉีซึีกีญีซี 4%-ีซึ 3%-ีซ ีซีปีฅึีดีกีถ ีบีกีฟีณีกีผีถีฅึีจี ีถีทีฅีฌีธีพ, ีธึ ีกีตีถ ีดีซีฟีพีกีฎ ีง ีฃีถีกีณีกีตีซีถ ีฝีบีกีฝีธึีดีถีฅึีซ ีดีฅีฒีดีดีกีถีจ ึ ีฅึีฏีกึีกีชีกีดีฏีฅีฟ ีฟีถีฟีฅีฝีกีฏีกีถ ีฆีกึีฃีกึีดีกีถีจึ ีีก ีกีถีคึีกีคีกึีฑีฅีฌ ีง ีถีกึ ีพีฅึีกึีซีถีกีถีฝีกีพีธึีดีกีถ ีฟีธีฏีธีฝีกีคึีธึีตึีซี ีดีซีถีนึ 7% ีถีพีกีฆีฅึีดีกีถีจ, ีฉีฅึ ีกีตีฝ ึีกีตีฌีจ ีคีฅีผึีฝ ีนีซ ีฐีกีถีฃีฅึึีฅีฌ ีคึีกีดีซ ีกึีชึีธึีดีกีถ, ีพีกึีฏีฅึีซ ีงีกีฏีกีถ ีงีชีกีถีกึีดีกีถ ึ ีฃีถีกีณีซึ ิฟิฒ ีบีกีทีฟีธีถีตีกีถ ีฐีกีตีฟีถีฅีฌ ีง, ีธึ ีฅึีฏึีซ ีจีถีคีฐีกีถีธึึ ีพีกึีฏีกีตีซีถ ีบีธึีฟึีฅีฌีจ ีฏีกีฆีดีธึีด ีง 14 ีดีซีฌีซีกึีค ีคีธีฌีกึ, ีธึีซึ ีนีกีทีญีกีฟีธีฒ ีพีกึีฏีฅึีซ ีขีกีชีซีถีจี 3,2%, ีฐีกีดีกึีพีธึีด ีง ีธีน ีดีฟีกีฐีธีฃีซีน ึีธึึีกีถีซีทึ
